question: Why is the woman insistent that the boy gets back in the car?

options.A: Because she is afraid the boy will get hurt if he stays outside too long and wants to get him back in the car for safety.
options.B: Because she sees something suspicious in the area and wants to move quickly to avoid trouble.
options.C: Because she realizes they are running late and needs to get back on the road to continue their trip.
options.D: Because she hears sirens and does not want to interact with the police, so she wants to leave the area.

correct_answer: Because she hears sirens and does not want to interact with the police, so she wants to leave the area.

question: What is the woman feeling when she pulls the item out of the cardboard box?

options.A: She feels nervous.
options.B: She feels confused.
options.C: She feels surprised.
options.D: She feels excited.

correct_answer: She feels confused.

question: What is the emotional progression of the woman in this scene?

options.A: Annoyance → Anger → Embarrassment
options.B: Confusion → Realization → Fear
options.C: Annoyance →  Realization →  Embarrassment
options.D: Confusion → Realization →  Relief

correct_answer: Confusion → Realization → Fear

question: Why is the girl upset with the woman in the pink and white shirt?

options.A: Because, as a child, she thought the woman was ignoring her on purpose, even though that wasn’t the intention at all.
options.B: Because, as a child, she hasn't yet understood why people with disabilities are differentiated from the rest of the population.
options.C: Because, as a child, she assumed that the woman’s behavior meant she didn’t like her or want her around.
options.D: Because, as a child, she misinterpreted the woman’s actions and thought she was being blamed for something unfair.

correct_answer: Because, as a child, she hasn't yet understood why people with disabilities are differentiated from the rest of the population.

question: Why didn't the girl in the red jacket greet the girl in the blue jacket when she came in?

options.A: She didn’t greet her because she assumed the girl in the blue jacket wasn’t looking for her.
options.B: She didn’t greet her because she assumed the girl didn’t want to be bothered.
options.C: She didn't greet her because she didn't see her since her back was turned.
options.D: She didn’t greet her because she thought it might have been the wrong time.

correct_answer: She didn't greet her because she didn't see her since her back was turned.
movie_title: 3 MINUTES OF SILENCE ft. Bella Ramsey

question: What is the man trying to tell the woman with his left hand while taking a picture?

options.A: He wants the woman to smile a little more.
options.B: He wants the woman to move slightly to his right.
options.C: He wants the people behind her to move so he can take the photo.
options.D: He’s asking the woman to switch her pose.

correct_answer: He wants the woman to move slightly to his right.

question: Why did the woman in the red coat have that reaction when she saw the crib?

options.A: She reacted that way because she thought the crib had been given away already.
options.B: She reacted that way because she assumed no one would keep something so old.
options.C: She reacted that way because she didn't know the crib would be there.
options.D: She reacted that way because she thought the room had been cleared out entirely.

correct_answer: She reacted that way because she didn't know the crib would be there.

question: Why does the blonde woman state that she brought the wine?

options.A: She is mentioning it because she believes the wine will be an important part of the celebration and wants to highlight that.
options.B: She wants to be acknowledged and appreciated by her family.
options.C: She wants to set the tone for the evening, making sure everyone knows the wine is available and ready to be served.
options.D: She is trying to make sure the family knows she contributed to the gathering and wants credit for it.

correct_answer: She wants to be acknowledged and appreciated by her family.

question: Why does the woman tell the little girl that she cannot come on the journey?

options.A: She wants the little girl to become independent and strong.
options.B: She is using a white lie to hide the fact that she will be leaving the little girl soon.
options.C: She is expressing guilt at being busy with her career.
options.D: She is implying that as one grows up they have to do most things alone.

correct_answer: She is using a white lie to hide the fact that she will be leaving the little girl soon.

question: Why does the man stop the woman from putting makeup on him for the show?

options.A: He felt like the makeup artist was judging him and his looks so he felt anxious about her being so close to his face.
options.B: His insecurity regarding his masculinity compels him to stop her from putting makeup on him.
options.C: He felt like she was putting too much makeup on him and that it would not look cohesive with the show.
options.D: He did not feel comfortable putting makeup on because he was scared that his dance partner would judge him.

correct_answer: His insecurity regarding his masculinity compels him to stop her from putting makeup on him.

question: How does the older man know the younger man was lying?

options.A: The older man knew based on the fact that the young man's story seemed made up.
options.B: The older man knew based on his observations of the younger man's knuckles, which were unbruised.
options.C: The older man could tell by the young man's tone.
options.D: The older man knew because the young man smiled.

correct_answer: The older man knew based on his observations of the younger man's knuckles, which were unbruised.

question: Why does the woman begin to move containers?

options.A: She thinks that shifting the containers will create a more practical living space and make daily routines easier for both of them.
options.B: She thinks that moving the containers will make the apartment feel less oppressive and help her regain a sense of personal control.
options.C: She thinks that reducing the clutter in the apartment will demonstrate her commitment to improving her condition in the eyes of the man.
options.D: She thinks that rearranging the containers will distract the man from his frustrations long enough to keep him from leaving.

correct_answer: She thinks that reducing the clutter int he apartment will demonstrate her commitment to improving her condition in the eyes of the man.

question: Why did the man offer the girl a slush ice?

options.A: He notices the girl looking at the food and thinks she wants it.
options.B: He wants the girl to like him so he tries to please her with it.
options.C: He wants to change the topic so the girl feels less awkward.
options.D: He noticed the girl is sad and wants to cheer her up.

correct_answer: He noticed the girl is sad and wants to cheer her up.

question: Why didn't the woman in the white blouse respond to the friend who greeted her?

options.A: Because she didn’t recognize the voice and wasn’t sure who was speaking.
options.B: Because she was distracted and didn’t realize someone was speaking to her.
options.C: Because she wasn’t in the mood to talk and chose to ignore it.
options.D: Because she wanted to hide the fact that she wasn't deaf.

question: How does the woman feel when her phone rings?

options.A: The woman is curious to know who is calling her.
options.B: The woman is nervous that the call might be bad news.
options.C: The woman is excited that someone is calling.
options.D: The woman is annoyed by the call.

correct_answer: The woman is annoyed by the call.

question: Why does the man look out the window when he hears the car?

options.A: The man looks out the window to see how many people are in the car.
options.B: Because the man believes the woman lied to him about who is picking her up.
options.C: The man looks out the window to see what car the woman's friend is driving.
options.D: He looks out the window to see if the car is big enough for him to ride with them.

correct_answer: Because the man believes the woman lied to him about who is picking her up.

question: Why does the little girl laugh at the old man?

options.A: His excitement amuses her.
options.B: She is amused by his disgust.
options.C: She wants the man to feel embarrassed.
options.D: She is nervous so she laughs.

question: How does the man feel as he paces across the room?

options.A: He feels excited that something he’s waiting for is going to arrive.
options.B: He feels nervous while waiting for something.
options.C: He feels annoyance because something he’s waiting for hasn’t arrived.
options.D: He feels remorse that what he's waiting for is arriving late.

question: Why does the bride's father wish the man in the green shirt a "happy wedding day?"

options.A: He is excited for the wedding.
options.B: To show that he cares for his wellbeing.
options.C: He wants the man to enjoy the wedding.
options.D: To sarcastically express his anger.

question: Why does the boy turn to look at the man with the glasses?

options.A: The boy turns to the man with the glasses for help opening his pencil case.
options.B: The boy looks at him because he wants him to leave him alone.
options.C: The boy looks at him because he hears the man's phone ring.
options.D: The boy looks at him because the man calls his name.

question: What was the man looking for when he turned the music on?

options.A: He wanted to distract the woman from their argument with another atmosphere
options.B: He was trying to lighten up himself after the argument.
options.C: He hoped the music would help him to process his own feelings and calm down.
options.D: He was trying to get closer to the woman both physically and emotionally.

question: Why doesn't the man tell the girl not to hit the fish tanks?

options.A: The man didn't tell her because he wasn't looking at her, as he stood at the entrance of the store.
options.B: The man didn’t tell her because he didn’t want to embarrass her, as he thought it wasn’t a big deal.
options.C: The man didn’t tell her because he thought someone else would step in, as he was not in charge.

question: Why doesn't the girl with her hair down ignore the other girl calling her name?

options.A: The girl with her hair down does not hear the other girl calling her name.
options.B: The girl with her hair down thinks that the other girl is annoying and doesn't want to engage in conversation.
options.C: The girl with her hair down does not know that the other girl is angry.

correct_answer: The girl with her hair down does not know that the other girl is angry.

question: Why does the older woman with short brown hair mention how she helps the elderly woman in the bathroom?

options.A: She wants to make her daughters understand the reality of her condition.
options.B: She wanted an excuse to talk about how neat and clean the bathroom is.
options.C: Because she is bragging about her caregiving skills.
options.D: She was hoping someone would volunteer to take over bathroom duty next time.

correct_answer: She wants to make her daughters understand the reality of her condition.

question: What does the blonde-haired girl assume when she sees people talking?

options.A: She assumes they are planning a surprise for her since she is new.
options.B: She believes they are talking about drama within the family.
options.C: She believes that they are probably judging her.
options.D: She believes they want to steal her strategy for playing the game.

correct_answer: She believes that they are probably judging her.
